chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon Jr in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon Jr.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Final Pre-trial. State has filed Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial. Defense does not object. Court finds good cause to GRANT the request and VACATES the 10/24/2022 jury trial.  Court sets new dates for Final Pretrial and Jury trial.  Case adjourned to Br. 9
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am. Jury trial scheduled for February 27, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-19-2022, filed.
State's Notice of Motion to Adjourn, filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report 10-4-2022, filed.

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon Jr in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference.  Defendant was previously ordered to appear at Justice Point to re-test.  Justice Point has advised the Court that the Defendant complied and drug test was negative. Jury Trial remains set for 10/24/2022 at 8:30 am. Case adjourned to Br. 9 for Final Pretrial on 10/20/2022 at 9:00 a.m.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-3-2022, filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-30-2022, filed.

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon Jr in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Camryn Arroyo, Case Manager with Justice Point appeared in court.

Case in Court to address recent Justice Point violation. State's bail motion heard and denied.  Court ORDERS the defendant to report to Justice Point on 10/3/2022 at 8:30 am for re-testing.  Case adjourned to Br. 9 for further Status conference. Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 9-28-2022, filed.
Motion for Modification of Briefing Schedule, filed.

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting trial dates. Court sets the following deadlines:
- 08/26/2022: deadline for the State to have crime lab reports completed and turned over to defense.
- 10/06/2022: deadline for filing any change of plea forms.
- 10/13/2022: deadline for any final pretrial documents, including written stipulations.
- 10/20/2022: last day the Court will accept any negotiations.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court to address Justice Point violation. Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared as previously set.

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Bail Bond Hearing. Court addresses the defendant's pre-trial services discharge report dated 05/20/2022. Discussions with parties put forth on the record. Court takes no action as to bail for todays purposes, but re-instates Justice Point supervision Level 3. Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect. Case remains calendared as previously set.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 5-27-2022
Court in receipt of JusticePoint violation. Court notified parties of bail bond hearing scheduled for Friday, May 27th, 2022 at 8:15 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 5-20-2022
Received and Filed.  Pretrial Services Status Report 5-12-2022

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court has set deadlines for filings.  The State has until 4/29 to send Discovery to defense with the exception of Crime Lab Report; Any motions to be filed must be done by 6/6, the Court has set a hearing for an IN PERSON continued pre trial conference.  If the defendant elects to a change of plea, all documents pertaining to this must be filed by 6/20/22.   mn  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-11-2022
Pretrial Services Status Report 3-30-2022, Filed.

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon in court in person with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont who appears by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-2-2022
received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox-Dixon in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
